verses.t: Then{G1161} drew near{G1448} unto him{G846} all{G3956} the publicans{G3588} and{G2532} sinners{G268} for to hear{G191} him{G846}.

And{G1161} he spake{G2036} this{G3778} parable{G3588} unto{G4314} them{G846}, saying{G3004},

What{G5101} man{G444} of{G1537} you{G5216}, having{G2192} an hundred{G1540} sheep{G4263}, if{G2532} he lose{G622} one{G1520} of{G1537} them{G846}, doth{G2641} not{G3756} leave{G2641} the ninety and nine{G1768} in{G1722} the wilderness{G2048}, and{G2532} go{G4198} after{G1909} that which{G3588} is lost{G622}, until{G2193} he find{G2147} it{G846}?
And{G2532} when he hath found{G2147} it, he layeth{G2007} it on{G1909} his{G1438} shoulders{G3588}, rejoicing{G5463}.

And{G2532} when he cometh{G2064} home{G3588}, he calleth together{G4779} his friends{G5384} and{G2532} neighbours{G3588}, saying{G3004} unto them{G846}, Rejoice with{G4796} me{G3427}; for{G3754} I have found{G2147} my{G3450} sheep{G3588} which{G3588} was lost{G622}.

Either{G2228} what{G5101} woman{G1135} having{G2192} ten{G1176} pieces of silver{G1406}, if{G1437} she lose{G622} one{G1520} piece{G1406}, doth{G681} not{G3780} light{G681} a candle{G3088}, and{G2532} sweep{G4563} the house{G3588}, and{G2532} seek{G2212} diligently{G1960} till{G2193} she find{G2147} it?

And{G2532} when she hath found{G2147} it, she calleth{G4779} her friends{G3588} and{G2532} her neighbours{G3588} together{G4779}, saying{G3004}, Rejoice with{G4796} me{G3427}; for{G3754} I have found{G2147} the piece{G3588} which{G3739} I had lost{G622}.
Likewise{G3779}, I say{G3004} unto you{G5213}, there is{G1096} joy{G5479} in the presence of{G1799} the angels{G3588} of God{G3588} over{G1909} one{G1520} sinner{G268} that repenteth{G3340}.
And{G1161} he said{G2036}A certain{G5100} man{G444} had{G2192} two{G1417} sons{G5207}:

And{G2532} the younger{G3501} of them{G846} said{G2036} to{G3588} his father{G3962}, Father{G3962}, give{G1325} me{G3427} the portion{G3313} of goods{G3588} that falleth{G1911} to me. And{G2532} he divided{G1244} unto them{G846} his living{G3588}.

And{G2532} not{G3756} many{G4183} days{G2250} after{G3326} the younger{G3501} son{G5207} gathered{G4863} all{G537} together{G4863}, and took his journey{G589} into{G1519} a far{G3117} country{G5561}, and{G2532} there{G1563} wasted{G1287} his{G846} substance{G3588} with riotous{G811} living{G2198}.
And{G1161} when he{G846} had spent{G1159} all{G3956}, there arose{G1096} a mighty{G2478} famine{G3042} in{G2596} that{G1565} land{G3588}; and{G2532} he{G846} began{G756} to be in want{G5302}.

And{G2532} he went{G4198} and joined himself{G2853} to{G1520} a citizen{G3588} of that{G1565} country{G3588}; and{G2532} he sent{G3992} him{G846} into{G1519} his{G846} fields{G3588} to feed{G1006} swine{G5519}.
And{G2532} he would fain{G1937} have filled{G1072} his{G846} belly{G3588} with{G575} the husks{G3588} that{G3739} the swine{G3588} did eat{G2068}: and{G2532} no man{G3762} gave{G1325} unto him{G846}.

And{G1161} when he came{G2064} to{G1519} himself{G1438}, he said{G2036}, How many{G4214} hired servants{G3407} of my{G3450} father's{G3588} have bread{G740} enough and to spare{G4052}, and{G1161} I{G1473} perish{G622} with hunger{G3042}!

I will arise{G450} and go{G4198} to{G4314} my{G3450} father{G3588}, and{G2532} will say{G2046} unto him{G846}, Father{G3962}, I have sinned{G264} against{G1519} heaven{G3588}, and{G2532} before{G1799} thee{G4675},
And{G2532} am{G1510} no more{G3765} worthy{G514} to be called{G2564} thy{G4675} son{G5207}: make{G4160} me{G3165} as{G5613} one{G1520} of thy{G4675} hired servants{G3407}.

And{G2532} he arose{G450}, and came{G2064} to{G4314} his{G1438} father{G3588}. But{G1161} when he{G846} was{G568} yet{G2089} a great way off{G3112}, his{G846} father{G3588} saw{G1492} him{G846}, and{G2532} had compassion{G4697}, and{G2532} ran{G5143}, and fell{G1968} on{G1909} his{G846} neck{G3588}, and{G2532} kissed{G2705} him{G846}.

And{G1161} the son{G3588} said{G2036} unto him{G846}, Father{G3962}, I have sinned{G264} against{G1519} heaven{G3588}, and{G2532} in{G1799} thy{G4675} sight{G1799}, and{G2532} am{G1510} no more{G3765} worthy{G514} to be called{G2564} thy{G4675} son{G5207}.

But{G1161} the father{G3588} said{G2036} to{G4314} his{G846} servants{G3588}, Bring forth{G1627} the best{G4413} robe{G3588}, and{G2532} put{G1746} it on{G1746} him{G846}; and{G2532} put{G1325} a ring{G1146} on{G1519} his{G846} hand{G3588}, and{G2532} shoes{G5266} on{G1519} his feet{G3588}:
And{G2532} bring hither{G5342}the fatted{G4618} calf{G3448}, and kill{G2380} it; and{G2532} let us eat{G5315}, and be merry{G2165}:

For{G3778} this{G3778} my{G3450} son{G3588} was{G2258} dead{G3498}, and{G2532} is alive again{G326}; he was{G2258} lost{G622}, and{G2532} is found{G2147}. And{G2532} they began{G756} to be merry{G2165}.UNABLE to manipulate tags!

Now{G1161} his{G846} elder{G4245} son{G3588} was{G2258} in{G1722} the field{G68}: and{G2532} as{G5613} he came{G2064} and drew nigh{G1448} to the house{G3588}, he heard{G191} musick{G4858} and{G2532} dancing{G5525}.

And{G2532} he called{G4341} one{G1520} of the servants{G3588}, and asked{G4441} what{G5101} these things{G5023} meant{G1498}.UNSURE: Tagging of genitive "autos" seeming that it could imply "he asked of him".

And{G1161} he said{G2036} unto him{G846}, Thy{G4675} brother{G3588} is come{G2240}; and{G2532} thy{G4675} father{G3588} hath killed{G2380} the fatted{G4618} calf{G3448}, because{G3754} he hath received{G618} him{G846} safe and sound{G5198}.
And{G1161} he was angry{G3710}, and{G2532} would{G2309} not{G3756} go in{G1525}: therefore{G3767} came{G1831} his{G846} father{G3962} out{G1831}, and intreated{G3870} him{G846}.

And{G1161} he answering{G611} said{G2036} to{G3588} his father{G3962}, Lo{G2400}, these many{G5118} years{G2094} do I serve{G1398} thee{G4671}, neither{G2532} transgressed I{G3928} at any time{G3763} thy{G4675} commandment{G1785}: and{G2532} yet thou{G1325} never{G3763} gavest{G1325} me{G1698} a kid{G2056}, that{G2443} I might make merry{G2165} with{G3326} my{G3450} friends{G5384}:

But{G1161} as soon as{G3753} this{G3778} thy{G4675} son{G3588} was come{G2064}, which{G3588} hath devoured{G2719} thy{G4675} living{G3588} with{G3326} harlots{G4204}, thou hast killed{G2380} for him{G846} the fatted{G4618} calf{G3448}.
And{G1161} he said{G2036} unto him{G846}, Son{G5043}, thou{G4771} art{G1488} ever{G3842} with{G3326} me{G1700}, and{G2532} all{G3956} that I have{G1699} is{G2076} thine{G4674}.

It was meet{G1163} that we should make merry{G2165}, and{G2532} be glad{G5463}: for{G3754} this{G3778} thy{G4675} brother{G3588} was{G2258} dead{G3498}, and{G2532} is alive again{G326}; and{G2532} was{G2258} lost{G622}, and{G2532} is found{G2147}.
